item.title: Django on Jython: Ready for Production
item.description:
Description

Django on Jython: Ready for Production

Presented by Chris McAvoy

Talks about runnin Django on Jython. Walks through technical issues with getting Django running on Jython, but also talks about why you might want to do this and what it enables.
item.dc:creator: Chris McAvoy

item.title: Lightning Talks Day 3
item.description:
Description

Lightning Talks Day 3

(00:07) Solace, a multilingual support platform - Armin Ronacher

(03:50) Dig Deeper, Digging through the Django source code - ?

(09:50) PSF, Pony Magic - James Tauber
item.dc:creator: Armin Ronacher

item.title: Fighting malnutrition with SMS and Django
item.description:
Description

Fighting malnutrition with SMS and Django

Presented by Andy Mckay

Case study about using sms and django on a project called rapidsms.
item.dc:creator: Andy Mckay

item.title: Google Summer of Code Overview Panel
item.description:
Description

Google Summer of Code Overview Panel

Featuring Zain Memon, Alex Gaynor, Honza Kral, Marc Garcia

Moderated question and answer about GSOC and Django.
item.dc:creator: Zain Memon

item.title: How to name your open source Django project after a famous Jazz musician, and concepts behind Django-Mingus, a project leveraging only reusable apps.
item.description:
Description

How to name your open source Django project after a famous Jazz musician, and concepts behind Django-Minus, a project

Presented by Kevin Fricovsky
item.dc:creator: Kevin Fricovsk

item.title: No! Bad Pony!
item.description:
Description

No! Bad Pony!

Presented by Russell Keith-Magee

Talks about ponies, genesis of ponies, the history of the pony, magical powers, and everything else you want to know about ponies. Talks about how django feature proposals are handled.
item.dc:creator: Russell Keith-Magee

item.title: Now What
item.description:
Description

Now What

Presented by Ted Leung
item.dc:creator: Ted Leung

item.title: Painless Django app localization with Transifex
item.description:
Description

Painless Django app localization with Transifex

Presented by Dimitris Glezos

Talks about Transifex, what it does, how it works, and how to use it to localize your application.
item.dc:creator: Dimitris Glezos

item.title: When not to use the ORM: bulk data loading strategies for large datasets.
item.description:
Description

When not to use the ORM: bulk data loading strategies for large datasets

Justin Bronn

Talks about data loading strategies for very large datasets and why not to use an ORM when doing it.
item.dc:creator: Justin Bronn

item.title: Customizing your Satchmo Store
item.description:
Description

Customizing your satchmo store

Presented by Chris Moffitt

Talks about django development with satchmo. Satchmo is an open source framework for creating online stores.
item.dc:creator: Chris Moffitt

item.title: A socio-political analysis of open source community
item.description:
Description

DjangoCon presents A socio-political analysis of open source community

Presented by Ian Bicking

Covers why are we doing what we're doing and why it matters in terms of Open Source and the movement. Focuses on the Django community, what's being produced and finding meaning in that.
item.dc:creator: Ian Bicking

item.title: Lightning Talks Day 2
item.description:
Description

Lightning Talks Day 2

(00:09) Dive into CPython Bytecode - Alex Gaynor

(05:10) Testing with pywatch - Chris Heisel

(07:08) Pluggable Django E-Commerce - Aaron Cuker and someone else

(12:13) Introduction to Surlex - Cody Soyland
item.dc:creator: Alex Gaynor

item.title: Selling Django to Your Superiors: Success Stories Panel
item.description:
Description

Video freezes from 3:30-4:30, audio is fine.
item.dc:creator: Brian Luft

item.title: Introduction to Pinax
item.description:
Description

Introduction to Pinax

Presented by James Tauber and Daniel Greenfeld

Walks through what Pinax is, how it's useful to you, how to install it, and walks through building a simple site using Pinax.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Greenfeld

item.title: Making your PostgreSQL database sing
item.description:
Description

Making your PostgresSQL database sing

Presented by Frank Wiles at DjangoCon 2009

Talks about performance tuning with PostgresSQL.
item.dc:creator: Frank Wiles

item.title: Pluggable, Reusable Django Apps: A Use Case and Proposed Solution
item.description:
Description

Pluggable, reusable, django apps: A use case and proposed solution

Presented by Shawn Rider and Nowell Strite

Talks about Django usage in PBS maintained sites.

[VIDEO HAS ISSUES: audio jumps around a bit]
item.dc:creator: Shawn Rider

item.title: Using Django in Non-Standard Ways
item.description:
Description

Using Django in Non-Standard Ways

Eric Florenzano

First, tries to define what "non-standard ways" entails, then talks about using Django in these ways.

[VIDEO HAS ISSUES: video freezes at times, but audio continues]
item.dc:creator: Eric Florenzano

item.title: Cowboy Development with Django
item.description:
Description

Cowboy development with Django

Presented by Simon Willison

Hard to describe this talk--it's very entertaining.

[VIDEO HAS ISSUES: Audio is mostly in left speaker; lost audio at 36:45]

item.title: Database Migrations, South, And You
item.description:
Description

Database migrations, south and you

Presented by Andrew Godwin

Talks about south which makes it easier to do database migrations.

[VIDEO HAS ISSUES: audio tends towards left speaker]
item.dc:creator: Andrew Godwin

item.title: Django Technical Design Panel
item.description:
Description

Django Technical Design Panel

Featuring Joseph K, Russell Keith-Magee, Simon Willison, James Bennett, Brian

Moderated question and answer period covering a bunch of topics.

[VIDEO HAS ISSUES: sound only from left speaker]

item.description:
Description

Confessions of a life long Perl Bigot

Presented by Frank Wiles

Talks about Django from the perspective of the Perl world.

[VIDEO HAS ISSUES: is quiet]
item.dc:creator: Frank Wiles

item.description:
Description

Deploying Django

Presented by Brian Rosner

Talks about deploying django sites.

Presented by Eric Holscher

item.title: What the Heck Went Wrong?
item.description:
Description

What the heck went wrong?

Andy McKay

Talks about how to debug Django.

item.title: How to Contribute to Pinax
item.description:
Description

How to Contribute to Pinax

Presented by James Tauber

Talks about what Pinax is and how to contribute to the Pinax project.

Pinax project

item.title: UR DOING IT WRONG
item.description:
Description

UR DOIN IT WRONG

James Bennett

Talks about new people having problems doing what they're trying to do with Django. Some things discussed: not reading the documentation, learning Python as you go, ... Talks about the minimum Python you should know when working with Django.

[VIDEO HAS ISSUES: audio is soft at the beginning]
item.dc:creator: James Bennett
